defs.docs: Asynchronous cross-platform real-time audio recording & playback.

attributes.value: / Asynchronous cross-platform real-time audio recording & playback.
/ This example records audio and plays it back in real time as it's being
/ recorded.  (Make sure to wear headphones to avoid feedback):
/ /// An event handled by the event loop.
/     /// Speaker is ready to play more audio.
/ /// Shared state between tasks on the thread.
/     /// Temporary buffer for holding real-time audio samples.
/     /// Event loop.  Return false to stop program.
/     let mut state = State { buffer: Audio::with_silence(48_000, 0) };

warn(anonymous_parameters, missing_copy_implementations,
       missing_debug_implementations, missing_docs, nonstandard_style,
       rust_2018_idioms, single_use_lifetimes, trivial_casts,
       trivial_numeric_casts, unreachable_pub, unused_extern_crates,
       unused_qualifications, variant_size_differences)

defs.value:
pub async fn record<F: Frame<Chan = Ch32>, '_, '_>(&'_ mut Self)
-> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs:
Record audio from connected microphone.  Returns an audio stream, which
 contains the samples recorded since the previous call.

defs.name: Speakers
defs.docs: Play audio samples through a speaker.

attributes.value: / Play audio samples through a speaker.
/ **note:** This example depends on `twang = "0.5"` to synthesize the sine
/ /// An event handled by the event loop.
/     /// Speaker is ready to play more audio.
/ /// Shared state between tasks on the thread.
/     /// Event loop.  Return false to stop program.
/     let mut state = State { synth: Synth::new((), sine) };

defs.name: play
defs.value:
pub async fn play<F: Frame<Chan = Ch32>, '_, '_>(&'_ mut Self)
-> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs:
Play audio through speakers.  Returns an audio sink, which consumes an
 audio stream of played samples.  If you don't write to the sink, it will
 keep playing whatever was last streamed into it.

attributes.value: / Play audio through speakers.  Returns an audio sink, which consumes an
/ audio stream of played samples.  If you don't write to the sink, it will
/ keep playing whatever was last streamed into it.

defs.name: SpeakersSink
defs.docs: A sink that consumes audio samples and plays them through the speakers.

attributes.value: / A sink that consumes audio samples and plays them through the speakers.
